description:
VisIt is an Open Source, interactive, scalable, visualization, animation
and analysis tool.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
This is an earlier version of Intel parallel software development tools
and has now been replaced by the Intel oneAPI Toolkits. LICENSE
INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software, you agree to the
terms and conditions of the software license agreements at
https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: vtk
dependencies.description:
The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available
software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing and
visualization.

dependencies.name: glu
dependencies.description: Shim package for Apple implementation of OpenGL Utility Libray (GLU)

dependencies.name: qt
dependencies.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: qwt
dependencies.description:
The Qwt library contains GUI Components and utility classes which are
primarily useful for programs with a technical background. Beside a
framework for 2D plots it provides scales, sliders, dials, compasses,
thermometers, wheels and knobs to control or display values, arrays, or
ranges of type double.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: netcdf-cxx
dependencies.description:
Deprecated C++ compatibility bindings for NetCDF. These do NOT read or
write NetCDF-4 files, and are no longer maintained by Unidata.
Developers should migrate to current NetCDF C++ bindings, in Spack
package netcdf-cxx4.

dependencies.name: silo
dependencies.description:
Silo is a library for reading and writing a wide variety of scientific
data to binary, disk files.

dependencies.name: conduit
dependencies.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.

dependencies.name: mfem
dependencies.description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.

dependencies.name: libfms
dependencies.description: Field and Mesh Specification (FMS) library

dependencies.name: adios2
dependencies.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program

dependencies.name: vtk-m
dependencies.description:
VTK-m is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-m supports the fine-grained concurrency for
data analysis and visualization algorithms required to drive extreme
scale computing by providing abstract models for data and execution that
can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many different
processor architectures.

dependencies.name: vtk-h
dependencies.description:
VTK-h is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-h brings together several projects like
VTK-m and DIY2 to provide a toolkit with hybrid parallel capabilities.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependent_to.name: visit-ffp
dependent_to.description:
This is the FFP Plug-In for VisIt. Can be installed after VisIt is
installed with/without the STRIPACK library.

dependent_to.name: visit-cgns
dependent_to.description:
This is the CGNS Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along CGNS library.

dependent_to.name: damaris
dependent_to.description:
Damaris is a middleware for I/O and in situ analytics targeting large-
scale, MPI-based HPC simulations.

dependent_to.name: visit-unv
dependent_to.description: This is the UNV Plug-In for VisIt.

dependent_to.name: visit-mfem
dependent_to.description:
This is the MFEM Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along MFEM library.

dependent_to.name: visit-silo
dependent_to.description:
This is the Silo Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along SILO library. It is made as an extension to VisIt that
can be activated or as an environment with a view: ~/.visit Complete
explanation at:
https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/22907#issuecomment-824218296

dependent_to.name: sensei
dependent_to.description:
SENSEI is a platform for scalable in-situ analysis and visualization.
Its design motto is "Write once, run everywhere", this means that once
the application is instrumented with SENSEI it can use existing and
future analysis backends. Existing backends include: Paraview/Catalyst,
Visit/Libsim, ADIOS, Python scripts, and so on.
